text: We don’t yet have all the details of the horrifying events in Santa Clarita. But we do know that in America today, children are scared to go to school. Parents and teachers are terrified. And that can’t stand. It is time to hold the NRA and our leaders in Washington accountable.

text:
Today marks 18 years since the U.S. invaded Afghanistan.

There are now soldiers old enough to deploy who were born after September 11th. We should honor their courage and patriotism by putting an end to endless war.https://twitter.com/ABC/status/1181206375503994881 …
text_html: Today marks 18 years since the U.S. invaded Afghanistan. There are now soldiers old enough to deploy who were born after September 11th. We should honor their courage and patriotism by putting an end to endless war.https://twitter.com/ABC/status/1181206375503994881 …

text: This president’s shameful decision on Syria is the latest example of chaos masquerading as foreign policy. It goes against all military advice. It harms our national interests, emboldens our adversaries, and it will cost lives. The world urgently needs real American leadership.
text_html: This president’s shameful decision on Syria is the latest example of chaos masquerading as foreign policy. It goes against all military advice. It harms our national interests, emboldens our adversaries, and it will cost lives. The world urgently needs real American leadership.

text: Joshua Brown showed us what real courage looks like. Now we must show him and his family what real justice looks like. His murder must be investigated. We deserve answers.
text_html: Joshua Brown showed us what real courage looks like. Now we must show him and his family what real justice looks like. His murder must be investigated. We deserve answers.

text: Today would have been Fannie Lou Hamer's 102nd birthday. We must honor her legacy by fighting to end suppression—by breaking down the barriers that make it harder for Black Americans to vote. As president, I will do everything in my power to protect that fundamental right.
text_html: Today would have been Fannie Lou Hamer's 102nd birthday. We must honor her legacy by fighting to end suppression—by breaking down the barriers that make it harder for Black Americans to vote. As president, I will do everything in my power to protect that fundamental right.

text: The death penalty in America is not only a cruel practice, it furthers systemic racism and has taken too many Black lives. It cannot deliver equal or true justice—it's time for it to end. For proof, we need to look no further than the case of Rodney Reed.https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/06/us/rodney-reed-death-row-texas.html …

text: This president took an oath to protect and defend the Constitution. So did every member of Congress. This president violated that oath, betraying our country and leaving our representatives with no choice but to uphold their own. Congress must move forward with impeachment.
text_html: This president took an oath to protect and defend the Constitution. So did every member of Congress. This president violated that oath, betraying our country and leaving our representatives with no choice but to uphold their own. Congress must move forward with impeachment.

text: Digital platforms should accept their responsibility for truth in advertising, or they shouldn’t be in the business at all. If they run a political ad shown to be false, it should be removed—just like a TV station would do. We must act to protect our democracy in the digital age.
text_html: Digital platforms should accept their responsibility for truth in advertising, or they shouldn’t be in the business at all. If they run a political ad shown to be false, it should be removed—just like a TV station would do. We must act to protect our democracy in the digital age.

text: History will remember those who stood up to defend our republic, and the congressional Republicans who stood in their way.
text_html: History will remember those who stood up to defend our republic, and the congressional Republicans who stood in their way.

text: Lt. Col. Alexander Vindman is an American patriot who should be honored for his courage—in a war zone and in a congressional hearing room. It's time for congressional Republicans to summon just an ounce of his courage by putting country ahead of party and supporting impeachment.

text:
This week marks the anniversaries of three of the deadliest mass shootings in American history: Fort Hood and Sutherland Springs, Texas; and Thousand Oaks, California.

Our calendars are filling up with reminders of Washington’s failure to keep us safe. It’s time for change.

text:
There will come a day when Donald Trump is no longer in office.

A 14-year-old boy.

text: We both believe every American has the right to health care. We just diverge on how to make it a reality. The current rules of our politics might say this means we shouldn't talk to each other—but it’s better that we exchange ideas and bear in mind our common goal.

text:
We were warned. 

Now it has begun: ISIS benefits from the president’s abandonment of our allies in Syria.

text: Every woman should be able to make decisions about their own health regardless of their income. The urgency of this moment demands we act to end Hyde, and it calls on us to deliver reproductive justice for all women. #BeBoldEndHyde

text: I was in high school when Columbine happened. Years have passed, yet the only thing Washington politicians do consistently is fail to deliver. We owe it to our children to give them back their childhoods. We can’t wait. We need leaders ready to act. #DemDebate
text_html: I was in high school when Columbine happened. Years have passed, yet the only thing Washington politicians do consistently is fail to deliver. We owe it to our children to give them back their childhoods. We can’t wait. We need leaders ready to act. #DemDebate

text:
Washington politicians are measuring the wrong thing.

What good is it if the Dow goes up but middle-class families can't pay their bills? As president, my focus won't just be on the growth of the the stock market. It will be on the growth of your paycheck. #DemDebate
